enWisdom: Trusting in Allah stems from strength of certitude

Wisdom: التَّوَكُّلُ التَّبَرِّي مِنَ الْحَوْلِ وَالْقُوَّةِ وَانْتِظَارُ مَا يَأْتِي بِهِ الْقَدَرُ
enWisdom: Trusting in Allah means distancing oneself from [reliance upon one’s] strength and power, and waiting for what is brought by divine decree

Wisdom: أَقْوَى النَّاسِ إِيمَاناً أَكْثَرُهُمْ تَوَكُّلًا عَلَى اللَّهِ سُبْحَانَهُ
enWisdom: The people who are strongest in faith are those who rely the most on Allah, the Glorified

Wisdom: إِنَّ حُسْنَ التَّوَكُّلِ لَمِنْ [مِنْ‏] صِدْقِ الْإِيقَانِ [الْإِيمَانِ‏]
enWisdom: Verily the perfection of trust in Allah stems from the verity of certitude

Wisdom: حُسْنُ تَوَكُّلِ الْعَبْدِ عَلَى اللَّهِ عَلَى قَدْرِ ثِقَتِهِ بِهِ
enWisdom: The strength of a servant’s trust in Allah is to the extent of his reliance on Him
It is in trusting Allah that the true essence of conviction lies
Whoever relies upon Allah puts his trust in Him
